intro: Sphaerostephanos albosetosus, commonly known as the white-hairy stephanos, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a subtle beauty to its habitat. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in its arid environment. Its botanical features include narrow, lance-shaped leaves and a short, upright stem. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
